metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4283 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This security flaw occurs because theXkbCopyNames function left a dangling pointer to freed memory, resulting inout-of-bounds memory access on subsequent XkbGetKbdByName requests.. Thisissue can lead to local privileges elevation on systems where the X serveris running privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
xserver-common - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
xvfb - 2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.3-2ubuntu2.5').
xwayland package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.1-1ubuntu0.4').
